artist: Don Carlson; Al Madl; John Oster Manufacturing Company
description: chrome base with undulating surface; glass top
medium: Chromium-plated steel, glass, rubber, electrical components
text: The classic 1953 "Osterizer" was designed by Don Carlson and Al Madl. It shares with and earlier MÃ¼ller-Munk designed model a heavy chromed base but the stepping is rounded rather than hard-edged, topped with a rather chunky glass top. Although designed for the domestic market, it has the look and feel of professional, high-tech catering equipment. The blender makes an interesting appearance in the 1991 remake of the movie, "Father of the Bride."
title: "Osterizer" blender, model 403
